conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to analyze the forces and motion of the rods in the magnetic field.
Gravitational Force: The component of the gravitational force acting down the incline is m_a g sin theta.
Magnetic Force: The magnetic force on rod a due to the current I is B I L.
Net Force: The net force on rod a is the applied force F minus the gravitational component and the magnetic force.
Gravitational Force: The component of the gravitational force acting down the incline is m_b g sin theta.
Magnetic Force: The magnetic force on rod b is also B I L.
Net Force: The net force on rod b is the magnetic force minus the gravitational component.
The current I is induced due to the motion of the rods in the magnetic field.
The induced emf E is given by: E = B L (v_a + v_b)
The total resistance R_total is 2R since both rods have resistance R.
The current I is: I = E / R_total = B L (v_a + v_b) / 0.2
The work done by the force F is converted into kinetic energy and heat.
Given Q_a = 0.12 J and v_a = 1.0 m/s, we can solve for x and v_b.
Work Done by Force F: W = F x = 2x
